body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This question is from RMO 1990."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N is a 50 digit number (in the decimal scale). All digits except the 26th digit (from the left)
are 1. If N is divisible by 13, find the 26th digit."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Also post a solution, if you do this."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As usual my solution is the worst and involves extreme bashing.I wont even bother to write it up nicely."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" N = 1111...a..1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" occurring "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"25"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" times before "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"24"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" times after it.Expanding it out we get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N = (10^{49} + 10^{48} + \cdots + 10^{25}) + (a \times 10^{24}) + (10^{23} + \cdots + 1) = \dfrac{10^{25} ( 10^{25} - 1 ) }{9} + a \times 10^{24} + \dfrac{10^{24}-1}{9} = \dfrac{10^{25}( 10^{25}-1) + 9\times a\times 10^{24} + 10^{24} - 1}{9}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If we use the Geometric Progression Sum formula. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now clearly "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\mid"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{numerator}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".Because of Fermat 's Little theorem.We must also have that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"13"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\mid"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{numerator}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Again using FLT we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10^{12} \equiv 1 \pmod {13} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Now u have to use this congruence on the numerator and deduce that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9 \times a \times 10^{24} \equiv 1 \pmod {13}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since we already have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10^{24} \equiv 1 \pmod {13}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" from FLT "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies 9 \times a \equiv 1 \pmod {13}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a digit thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0 \leq a \leq 9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Make "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" cases for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" put each one of them and see which one leaves remainder "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on division by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"13"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Clearly "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9 \times 3 = 27 \equiv 1 (\mod 13)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" thus answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number is 1111 (24 times) 1 x   (1111 24 times)  ------ 26 th digit is x"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Test of divisibility for 7, 11 and 13 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"step 1 make groups of 3 digits from the end "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"step 2  add groups at odd places and add groups at even piaces"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"step 3 find the difference in above two additions "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If difference is 0 or divisible by 7, 11 or 13 then the given no is divisible by 7, 11 or 13"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"in above case first 24 digits (8 groups) and last 24 digits divisible divisible by 13"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so remaining  (1 x) must be divisible by 13 so x = 3"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"if it is asked 26 digit from right then x = 9 to make 91 divisible by 13"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Divisibility test of 13 can be used here."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Last 24 digits will be cancelled off by using the method."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now if I observe every 6 1's from right gets divided by 13 completely."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So now we are left with 25th and 26th digits."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So it is clear that with unit digit 1 only 13 is the multiple so 3 is the answer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know that the cyclicity of 13 is 6. Therefore, any six digit number with the same digits will always be divisible by 13.
Thus the set of first 24 and last 24 digits must always be divisible by 13. Lets consider 25th and 26th digit.
Let the 26th digit be X.
∴ The remainder obtained when  (25th & 26th digit is divided by 13 is 10 + x.
∴ x = 3 so that the remainder will become 13 ≡ 0."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If there were such a pair "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it would satisfy the equation
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2 + a + 1 = b^3 + b^2 + b + 1."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Subtracting one and factoring gives
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a+1)a = (b^2 + b + 1)b."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the greatest common divisor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"; write "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = a'd"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b = b'd"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(da'+1)a' = (eb' + 1)b'\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \text{with}\ \ \ \ e = d(b^2 + b)."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"da'+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is one more than a multiple of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", they are coprime; the same holds true for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e'b+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Moreover, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are coprime. But then this equation can only be satisfied if
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"da'+1 = b',\ \ \ a' = eb' + 1."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
This would imply that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a' > b'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b' > a'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is impossible."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Pi Han Goh – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" I only use it to try and convince you that the equation always has at least one real solution, contrary to what you claim. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Posted."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Ah "},{"type":"text","text":"Cardano's","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":". I'm not a huge fan of it, but I appreciate this approach.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Perhaps you should post a solution? I, for one, am interested to see it."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For every value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b \geq 2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" there exists a positive real number
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = \frac{\sqrt{4(b^3 + b^2 + b) + 1} - 1}2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2 + a + 1 = b^3 + b^2 + b + 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"; the only problem is that it never is an integer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Conversely, given "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a \geq 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", define "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"q = a^2 + a + \frac7{27}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D = q^2 + \frac{32}{729}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b = \sqrt[3]{\frac q2 + \frac12\sqrt D} + \sqrt[3]{\frac q2 - \frac12\sqrt D} - \frac 13,"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
we have again a positive solution for the equation, but it is never an integer.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I find it easier to just show that the cubic discriminant of the polynomial (in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") is always negative.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Disclaimer:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" As pointed out by Arjen, my Method 1 is completely wrong! But my method 2 still works! Yayyyy!!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method 1:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":"  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The equation in question is equivalent to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2 + a + 1 = b^3 + b^2 + b + 1 \Leftrightarrow b^3 + b^2 + b + (-a^2 - a) = 0 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose there exist number bases "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then the cubic equation above (in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") must have a non-negative "},{"type":"text","text":"discriminant","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":". That is"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1 - 4 - 4 (-a^2 - a) - 27(-a^2 - a)^2 + 18(-a^2 - a) \geq 0 . "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Simplifying this inequality gives "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"27 a^4 + 54 a^3 + 41 a^2 + 14 a + 3 \leq 0 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". But since every single term in LHS is a positive number, the inequality cannot be fulfilled. A contradiction!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method 2:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The equation in question is equivalent to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2 + a + 1 = b^3 + b^2 + b + 1 \Leftrightarrow a^2 + a + (-b^3 - b^2 - b) = 0 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose there exist number bases "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then the "},{"type":"text","text":"discriminant","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" above (in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") must be a perfect square. That is, for some integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":","}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1^2 - 4(-b^3 - b^2 - b) = c^2 \quad \Leftrightarrow\quad 1-c^2 = 4(-b^3 - b^2 - b). "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is even, then LHS is odd and RHS is even, which is absurd. Thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be odd. Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c = 2d+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for some integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then the equation simplifies to"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1 - (2d + 1)^2 = 4(-b^3 - b^2 - b) \quad \Leftrightarrow\quad b^3 + b^2 + b + 1 = d^2 + d + 1 , "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"which is where we started with (just replacing "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). So, there's no solution by "},{"type":"text","text":"infinite descent","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Ah, sorry. For some reason, I was thinking of it from a "quadratic discriminant's point of view". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I won't remove "Method 1", but I'll leave a disclaimer for others to read.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Solution 1 won't work: A cubic equation has
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{cases}
\text{one real solution} & \text{if}\ D < 0 \\
\text{three real solutions} & \text{if}\ D > 0
\end{cases}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(Proof that there is always one real solution: let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x) = ax^3 + O(x^2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a > 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then there exist "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x_- < x_+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x_-) < 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x_+) > 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is continuous on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[x_-,x_+]"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the middle-value theorem says there exists "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x_- < x_0 < x_+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x_0) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The argument for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a < 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is similar.)

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider all primes p such that such that for every positive integer value of n, p does not divide a concatenation of n 1s (in base 10)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the sum of all such primes."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is a theorem for squaring numbers which only contains 1 in every single digit"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Count how many "1's" there are and writing all the numbers from 1 to the amount (Value of how many digits there are) and back.
1²=1   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11²=121   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111²=12321   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111²=1234321   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11111²=123454321   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111111²=12345654321   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111111²=1234567654321   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11111111²=123456787654321   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111111111²=12345678987654321"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By the way, this theorem only works for numbers under 9 digits"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

This kind of question often assumes only basic operations: adding, subtracting, multiplying, dividing, etc. Or rather, it should be stated that inserting additional numbers is allowed.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given there are 2018 1s, as shown below: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\underbrace{\\text{1  1  1  1  ......  1  1}}_\\text{{2018 1s}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" that you are allowed to add pluses between the 1s. What is the maximum number of pluses can be added so that the expression above equals to 8102?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As a starting approach one can try to maximise the number of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s in our expression: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111 \times a + 111 \times b + 11 \times c + 1 \times d = 8102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It is most efficient to use the most "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s as possible. Hence we want to maximise "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" s.t. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8102 - 1111 \times a \geq 2018 - 4a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This gives "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8102 - 5555 = 2547"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can continue by maximising "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" s.t. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2547 - 111 \times b \geq 2018 - 20 - 3b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This gives "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b = 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8102 - 5555 - 555 = 1992"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We now look for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" s.t. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1992 - 11 \times c = 2018 - 20 - 15 - 2c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" satisfies this."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Currently we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111 \times 5 + 111 \times 5 + 11 \times 1 + 1 \times 1981 = 8102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". With "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1991 ( = a + b + c + d - 1) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pluses. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d > 1981"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" < 2018 - 1981 - 16 = 21"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 1's left. So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" b < 7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and we can't reach "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Similarly if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 5, b = 4, d > 1981"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" < 2018 - 1981 - 12 - 20 = 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c < 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and we can't reach "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"One should note that there is a similar solutions for years "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2013"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2019"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Assuming we are summing the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s to equal the year reversed. All have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1991"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pluses."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"E.g. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111 \times 6 + 111 \times 4 + 11 \times 1 + 1 \times 1981 = 9102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as we swapped "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which gains "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and uses one more "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Likewise if we swap "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we can do earlier years:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111 \times 0 + 111 \times 10 + 11 \times 1 + 1 \times 1981 = 3102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is possible. We can't have any "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2102 = 11c + (2012 - 2c)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2012 + 9c = 2102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c = 10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2102 = 11 \times 10 + 1 \times 1992"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2001"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pluses."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is a matter of solving the linear programming problem to maximize "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c+d-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for nonnegative integers subject to the constraints
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1111a + 111b + 11c + d \; = \; 8102 \hspace{2cm} 4a + 3b + 2c +d \; = \; 2018 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
the maximum value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{1991}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is achieved with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d=1981"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I've realized you're not wrong and I'm not wrong.  We're just counting the number of "+" symbols diferently.  My objection is incorrect because I didn't account for the change to d.  But with the constraints we have, maximizing a + b + c + d is equivalent to minimizing 3a +  2b + c.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

We are creating "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c+d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" numbers, namely "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" copies of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" copies of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" copies of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" copies of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

"}]},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"They have to add to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111a + 111b + 11c + d = 8102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have to use exactly "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2108"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" copies of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4a + 3b + 2c + d = 2108"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"These numbers have to be joined together with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c+d-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pluses, so that is the quantity we need to maximize."}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Why maximize a + b + c + d?  That's not  the right target function.
The solution you have gives a + b + c + d - 1 = 1991.  If I change b to 4 and c to 13 I get a + b + c + d - 1 = 2000.  But I have many fewer '+' symbols."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What you want to do is "},{"type":"text","text":"miinimize","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":" 3"},{"type":"text","text":"a + 2","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"b + c.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Formulation:
Find values of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b,c,d)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a*1111 + b*111 + c*111 + d = 8102"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4*a + 3*b + 2*c + d = 2018"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(3*a + 2*b + c)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is minimized."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let us approach the problem from this perspective:
If we start with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d = 2018"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2017"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" symbols but the sum is only "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2108"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
If we change a ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 + 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" to an "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have one fewer ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" symbol, but the sum increases by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
If we change ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+1+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have two fewer ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" symbols, and the sum increases by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"99"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
If we change ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+1+1+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have three fewer ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" symbols, and the sum increases by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"999"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So how many ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" symbols do we remove going from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d=2018"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the correct solution?  Well, for each ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" we remove "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" symbols, and for each ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" we remove "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" symbols, while for each ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" we remove "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" symbol.  Thus the target function is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3a + 2b + c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Our heuristic is to maximize "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then maximize "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then maximize "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Each ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+1+1+1 \rightarrow 1111 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" transition increases the sum by an average of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"333 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" per ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" removed, while each ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+1+1 \rightarrow 111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" transition increases the sum by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"49.5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" per ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" removed, and each ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+1 \rightarrow 11 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" transition only increases the sum by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" per ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" removed."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a < 6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6666 + 1994 = 8660"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is too much. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
If we let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 5,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b < 6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by a similar calculation."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Finally, observe that if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b = 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then if we let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d = 1981"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have a solution.  These values of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" require removing only "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"26"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" signs.  And no other sum that removes only "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"26"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" signs will achieve the same sum."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now adding them, we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111a_{1} + 6105x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dividing them by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_{1} + 55x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is their arithmetic mean."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"'a_{i}'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" th term is given by  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_{i}  = a_{1} + (i-1)x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"                                                                  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence by comparing  , we get our answer as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_{56}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For any radix "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large (111)_r = r^2 + r + 1,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" hence the given summation is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large \sum_{r = 2}^{16} ( r^2 + r + 1 ) = 1645"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
Please see Jake Lai's first three lines for steps to get 1645."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum k^{2} = n(n+1)(2n+1)/6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum k = n(n+1)/2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and of course "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum 1 = n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". We get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{16(16+1)(2 \times 16+1)}{6} + \frac{16(16+1)}{2} + 16 - 3 = 1645"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"having to subtracting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" since we're missing "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111_{1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Alternatively, you could do something similar but taking advantage of the fact that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(k+1)^{2}-k = 111_{k}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111_3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in decimal system "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=13"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"111_4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in decimal system "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=21"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So we see that the numbers are in a series where the difference increases by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 :"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7+6\rightarrow13+8\rightarrow21+10\rightarrow31+12\rightarrow43........"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Summing these upto the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16^{th}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" term, we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed {1645}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"
